title: Sr Site Reliability Engineer - ML
description: About the Role Engine by MoneyLion partners with leading Financial Institutions to surface the richest, most comprehensive set of personalized financial product offers to the consumer. . As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will lead our efforts to scale our platform to new heights, ensuring the highest standards of security and reliability. This senior leadership role requires a strategic thinker with deep technical expertise in DevOps, microservices, and containers. You will be instrumental in guiding our DevOps architecture, mentoring engineers, and fostering collaboration across the engineering teams to drive automation and efficiency at scale. Key Responsibilities Lead strategic initiatives to enhance and scale our microservice infrastructure, employing AWS best practices and Terraform for infrastructure as code. Architect and implement the next generation of our platform using Kubernetes, incorporating modern tooling and methodologies to drive innovation. Work closely with our parent company's SRE team in Kuala Lumpur, ensuring alignment and cohesion across global departments. Spearhead the design and review process, providing critical feedback on RFCs and leading by example in our collaborative design process. Manage and remediate production infrastructure issues, including participating in on-call rotations, with a focus on minimizing impact and ensuring robustness. Promote and enforce best practices for security, leveraging your experience in compliant environments to enhance our overall security posture. Lead the improvement of our CI/CD pipelines, optimizing for efficiency, reliability, and scalability. Provide mentorship and guidance to engineering teams, fostering a culture of excellence, innovation, and continuous learning. About You Minimum of 5+ years in DevOps, with a proven track record of leading large-scale projects in a cloud environment, particularly AWS. Expertise in Kubernetes and its ecosystem, with hands-on experience in architecting, deploying, and managing containerized applications. Strong background in infrastructure as code, specifically Terraform, and experience with AWS services related to microservices and containers (ECS, EKS). Comprehensive understanding of CI/CD systems (Jenkins, CircleCI, GitHub Actions) and experience in automating build, test, and deployment pipelines. Proficiency in at least one programming language (Python or GO preferred), with the ability to write clean, maintainable code. Familiarity with compliance and security standards (PCI, SOC2, NIST) and a strategic approach to meeting and exceeding these requirements. Compensation: Estimated Salary: 160-180K. Please note that we are only considering candidate who are in a commutable distance to either our NYC or Tempe, Arizona office as this is a HYBRID role requiring 3 x per week in office. Gen is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusivity. We base employment decisions on merit, experience, and business needs, without considering race, color, national origin, age, religion, sex, pregnancy, genetic information, disability, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, military or veteran status, or other unlawful factors. Gen prohibits discrimination based on these protected characteristics and recruits talented candidates from diverse backgrounds. We consider individuals with arrest and conviction records and do not discriminate against employees for discussing their own pay or that of other employees or applicants. Learn more about pay transparency . To conform to U.S. export control regulations, applicant should be eligible for any required authorizations from the U.S. Government.
company_description: Gen (NASDAQ: GEN) is a global company dedicated to powering Digital Freedom through its trusted Cyber Safety brands.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description: About Us Globaledit, a division of CoCreativ, is the leading SaaS platform for creative production workflow management. Our platform empowers top brands, retailers, and entertainment companies to collaborate more efficiently and bring content to market faster. We are expanding our product team to build new features, improve platform usability, and integrate emerging technologies that drive creative productivity. About the Role We're looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to take ownership of our cloud infrastructure, deployment pipelines, and system monitoring. This role is ideal for someone who is highly autonomous, thrives in complex problem-solving, and is passionate about building resilient, scalable serverless systems. You'll play a critical role in ensuring our engineering teams can deploy code safely and efficiently, while continuously improving our AWS environment and DevOps processes. This role requires someone who's just as comfortable rolling up their sleeves to debug a critical incident as they are stepping back to identify long-term architectural improvements or cost optimization opportunities. What You'll Do Own our AWS serverless infrastructure, including Lambda, API Gateway, Step Functions, S3, ECS, EFS, Route 53, and CloudFront. Design, build, and maintain CI/CD pipelines, primarily in Azure DevOps (or comparable tools like TeamCity, GitHub Actions, etc.). Debug and resolve infrastructure issues end-to-end, understanding how data flows through our system and proactively identifying points of failure. Implement and lead best practices for monitoring, alerting, and incident response using Datadog. Establish and manage DevOps backlogs, priorities, and tasks independently, without needing constant direction. Champion operational excellence by driving initiatives that reduce incidents, improve observability, and increase deployment confidence. Collaborate closely with backend and frontend engineering teams to support deployment, configuration, and production readiness of new services. Identify opportunities for cost savings and infrastructure right-sizing and drive those initiatives through to completion. Contribute to documentation, process improvement, and DevOps tooling—leveraging automation wherever possible. Stay current on AWS advancements and DevOps best practices, applying them to continuously improve our platform. Requirements Who You Are 7+ years of DevOps or SRE experience, with at least 5 years in a Senior or Lead role. Deep knowledge of AWS services, particularly in serverless architectures. Strong understanding of how data flows through cloud-based systems, and where failures are likely to occur. Proficient with CI/CD pipelines—experience with Azure DevOps is preferred, but equivalent tools are acceptable. Skilled in debugging, root cause analysis, and proactive infrastructure monitoring, ideally using Datadog. Comfortable with coding and scripting (C#, NodeJS, Bash, etc.) and able to build infrastructure solutions hands-on. Self-starter—you take initiative, organize your work, prioritize effectively, and don't require micromanagement. Calm under pressure during incidents, but focused on preventing them through automation and systems design. Excellent communicator who can explain technical problems and solutions to various stakeholders. Nice to Have Advanced AWS knowledge and certifications Experience with SRE practices, SLOs, SLIs, and service monitoring Cost optimization experience in AWS environments Previous experience building observability systems with Datadog from the ground up Hands-on development experience from ideation to production deployment Comfortable coding solutions without over-reliance on AI coding tools, but savvy in using them for productivity when appropriate Benefits The anticipated salary range for this role is $150,000 - $175,000 annually. Ranges are based on various factors including the labor market, job type, internal equity, and budget. Exact offers are calibrated by work location, individual candidate experience, and skills relative to the defined job requirements. This is a hybrid role with several days per week onsite in our studios in Tribeca and requires flexibility to work in-office and remotely. We offer a competitive benefits package including major medical, dental and vision insurance, FSA, HSA, and employee discounts. Industrial Color is a division of CoCreativ, a family of integrated creative production companies. Industrial Color partners with top brands, agencies, and creative professionals providing a full range of essential production services. For over 30 years, we've led the industry through a culture of innovation, bringing state-of-the-art digital production and post-production solutions to our clients. Our headquarters is based in Tribeca, NY, with offices in Los Angeles and studios in Brooklyn and Los Angeles. Our clients include: L'Oreal, Publicis, Procter & Gamble, Tommy Hilfiger, Absolut Vodka, Nike, Estee Lauder, Amazon.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Hybrid)
description: RouteSmart Technologies , a leader in vehicle route optimization software technology, is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our development team. This role will report directly to the Lead Software Engineer and is responsible for designing, coding, and supporting a variety of web applications and services. These responsibilities include contributing to the development of a suite of cross-platform routing systems that integrate advanced GIS and mapping capabilities with intuitive design and seamless navigation. A deep understanding of RouteSmart products is essential to ensure features are implemented accurately and effectively. The ideal candidate will also offer valuable insights from the end-user perspective, helping to shape a user experience that is both functional and user-friendly. The typical base pay range for this position at the start of employment is expected to be between $115,000–$130,000 per year. RouteSmart Technologies, Inc. has different base pay ranges for different work locations within the U.S., and base pay will vary based on experience. This is a hybrid role; candidates must be able to commute to the office in Columbia, MD or Melville, NY . Candidates must reside within 50 miles and be available to work onsite several days per week. However, we will consider the right candidate for remote work if domiciled in one of the following states: Maryland, New York, Pennsylvania, DC, Virginia, Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Minnesota, New Jersey, North Carolina, Oregon, South Carolina, Texas, Washington. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Lead and mentor other members of the development staff in coordination with the Lead Software Engineer, including the assignment of and review of tasks Keep team up to date on the latest relevant development technologies and be able to recommend, prioritize, and integrate these technologies into all RouteSmart products Develop maintenance roadmaps for all development frameworks, libraries, and tools so we can remain current for all critical patches and major software updates Write both DDL and DML SQL commands, functions, and scripts Full stack development: both client and server-side development skills are required Write well designed, testable, and efficient code by using software development best practices Demonstrate the ability to identify and fix errors in code Write various back-end services that can be leveraged by web designers to create web products Research new industry coding standards that can be used to improve the team's ability to create secure, high-quality, high-performance applications Other duties/responsibilities as assigned Requirements Working knowledge of relational databases (Postgres, MS SQL, etc.) and optimizing database queries Working knowledge of GIS and similar mapping services extremely useful Understanding of web application security, session management, and code development best practices Education & Experience Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Technology, or a related field Experience with C# and .NET Core development using Visual Studio and other Microsoft development tools 10+ years minimum experience as a programmer writing both client and server-side components Experience in planning and delivering software platforms used across multiple products and organizational units Benefits RouteSmart offers its employees numerous opportunities for professional development. Our goal is to provide our employees with the chance to learn and grow as the company grows. We recognize that our employees are our most valuable asset. The work they do is key to our ability to provide high quality service to our clients. We also recognize that our employees are unique individuals with their own lifestyle and interests. RouteSmart Technologies pays a significant share of the cost of benefits for our employees. We believe our investment makes good business sense by helping to create a positive and productive work environment. Among the benefits we offer are: Medical/Dental/Vision/STD & LTD Plans Employer paid Life Insurance Plan Employee Training & Development 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan w/ Employer Match Vacation/Sick/Holiday Leave Tuition Reimbursement Flex hours Casual Dress RouteSmart Technologies is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Individuals seeking employment at RouteSmart Technologies are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation. We do not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies, or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us. All candidates must have legal authorization to permanently live and work in the United States. This position does not qualify for sponsorship.

title: UI Developer
description: Virtu Virtu is a leading financial firm that leverages cutting edge technology to deliver liquidity to the global markets and innovative, transparent trading solutions to our clients. As a market maker, Virtu provides deep liquidity that helps to create more efficient markets around the world. Our market structure expertise, broad diversification, and execution technology enables us to provide competitive bids and offers in over 19,000 securities, at over 235 venues, in 36 countries worldwide THE ROLE We are looking for an exceptional candidate to join our UI development team. Our team is a talented group of versatile software engineers who are collaborating with our entire Virtu Team to build the next generation of scalable web-based UIs and trading tools for our fast paced firm. The role is primarily focused on the frontend stack, but there could be opportunities to work on some backend as well. Members of this team collaborate closely with traders and other developers to gather and understand needs, and implement real-time trading, visualization, analysis and reporting tools. Ideal candidates will have a passion and talent for designing great, intuitive user interfaces as well as expansive experience around web technologies and Javascript frameworks. THE CANDIDATE: 5+ years of experience Expertise with web client languages (JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS) Familiarity with web client frameworks (React, Angular, Node), remote API design and architecture (REST, WebSockets) Experience with source code management (Git is a plus) Experience with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or KDB Object oriented design skills and familiarity with Java a plus Python experience is a plus Interest in trading and financial markets This role is based in our New York office with some flexibility to work hybrid. THE PROCESS: Following an initial resume screen, candidates will be invited to complete an online programming test. Those who perform well will be contacted to arrange a phone screen. All applying candidates for this role will be expected to provide UI examples of design built and implemented or websites worked on. Salary Range: $150,000 - $200,000 (salary range is exclusive of bonuses, benefits or other categories of compensation) Virtu Financial is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, welcoming you for who you are and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Staff Engineer - (front-end leaning)
description: At Cofactr, we're redefining the electronics supply chain with a platform that combines powerful software, an electronics marketplace, and in-house logistics support. We're a startup looking for skilled individuals who can handle ambiguity and complexity while remaining pragmatic. We're seeking a Senior Fullstack Engineer (front-end leaning) to help architect and build product features that transform how customers manage their components and data. This role is hands-on and high-impact: you'll own features end-to-end, lead technical decisions, mentor others, and help shape our engineering culture as we scale. You will Design, build, and own product functionality across the stack Lead projects and make critical technical trade-offs, balancing performance, scalability, and user experience Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and customer-facing teams to translate complex requirements into intuitive solutions Champion technical excellence in code quality, testing, accessibility, and performance Contribute to technical leadership by guiding peers, surfacing risks, and ensuring alignment with product goals Potentially step into a hands-on management role as the team grows Must Haves 8+ years of experience building and scaling complex SaaS products Deep expertise in React, TypeScript, and modern front-end frameworks Solid experience with Python backends and Postgres databases Proven ability to ship high-quality features from design to production in a startup environment Excellent communication skills—able to partner with product and non-technical stakeholders, surface key insights, and bring others along in decision-making Experience in technical leadership: setting direction, mentoring, and guiding teams through ambiguity Startup mentality: you are resilient, pragmatic, and ambitious, and you know how to push for impact while maintaining strong working relationships Benefits Competitive salary and equity 100% employee premium coverage of health, dental, and vision plans FSA offerings 401(k) with 4% company matching flexible time off policy Commuter benefits with a company contribution We are an equal opportunity employer that values and welcomes diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship or immigration status, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. To conform to U.S. Government technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here. We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Software Engineer
description: Mirage is the leading AI short-form video company. We're building full-stack foundation models and products that redefine video creation, production and editing. Over 20 million creators and businesses use Mirage's products to reach their full creative and commercial potential. We are a rapidly growing team of ambitious, experienced, and devoted engineers, researchers, designers, marketers, and operators based in NYC. As an early member of our team, you'll have an opportunity to have an outsized impact on our products and our company's culture. Our Products Captions Mirage Studio Our Technology AI Research @ Mirage Mirage Model Announcement Seeing Voices (white-paper) Press Coverage TechCrunch Lenny's Podcast Forbes AI 50 Fast Company Our Investors We're very fortunate to have some the best investors and entrepreneurs backing us, including Index Ventures, Kleiner Perkins, Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz , Uncommon Projects, Kevin Systrom, Mike Krieger, Lenny Rachitsky, Antoine Martin, Julie Zhuo, Ben Rubin, Jaren Glover, SVAngel, 20VC, Ludlow Ventures, Chapter One, and more. ** Please note that all of our roles will require you to be in-person at our NYC HQ (located in Union Square) We do not work with third-party recruiting agencies, please do not contact us** Software Engineer We don't use hierarchical titles or levels internally, but are currently hiring engineers who have operated at senior or staff+ scope. As a small, collaborative team, our engineers are trusted with a high-degree of ownership and agency. Engineering at Mirage isn't narrowly defined: we work across three archetypes, and most of us span more than one. Product Engineering Ship end‑to‑end product surfaces for creative and commercial workflows. Understand the capabilities and limitations of SOTA AI models and how to best leverage them in products. Instrument, A/B, and iterate rapidly with production data. Talk to users. Platform and Infrastructure Design and operate our core platform: (i.e. 3rd party providers, storage, billing, observability, security, API). Set technical direction for various product and platform features. Improve developer experience so the whole team ships faster. Build tools and integrations for non-engineering teams across the company to ensure they are set up to excel. Applied AI Bridge research to production across all modalities (video, audio, image, text). Build tools for the research team: evals, dataset curation. Blend our research models with external models to prototype new product experiences. What Makes You a Great Fit 5+ years of professional industry experience A track record of shipping high‑impact systems and/or products in production. Exceptional problem solving fundamentals and ability to learn. Excellent engineering taste combined with a strong sense of practicality and time-management. Able to operate effectively in an extremely fast-paced environment as well as scope and deliver projects end-to-end. Even better if... You have worked extensively with LLMs, generative media models, and have a pulse on where the technology is going. You are grounded, collaborative, and willing to do whatever it takes to help the team win. You have been a startup founder or an early engineer at one. Benefits: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans 401K with employer match Commuter Benefits Catered lunch multiple days per week Dinner stipend every night if you're working late and want a bite! Grubhub subscription Health & Wellness Perks (Talkspace, Kindbody, One Medical subscription, HealthAdvocate, Teladoc) Multiple team offsites per year with team events every month Generous PTO policy Captions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Please note benefits apply to full time employees only. Compensation Range: $185K - $285K

title: Senior iOS Software Engineer, Ads
description: About GameChanger: We believe in the life changing impact youth sports have on and off the field. Sports encourage leadership, teamwork, responsibility, and confidence – important life lessons that have the power to propel our youth toward meaningful futures. We recognize that without coaches, parents, and volunteers, organized youth sports could not exist. By building the first and best place to experience the youth sports moments important to our community, we are helping families elevate the next generation through youth sports. So if you love sports and their community building potential, or building cool products is your sport, GameChanger is the team for you. We are a remote first, dynamic tech company based in New York City, and we are solving some of the biggest challenges in youth sports today. The Position: The Ads team is responsible for building new mobile ad experiences that help GameChanger grow while keeping the product simple and useful for coaches, parents, and fans. This is a small team where every engineer meaningfully contributes in shaping our mobile advertising foundation. As a Senior iOS Engineer, you will report to the Senior Engineering Manager of our Ads team and bring strong expertise in building and shipping native mobile apps to deliver high quality, performance features in our iOS application. You will collaborate closely with product, design, and engineering partners to create ad experiences that feel intuitive, non disruptive, and aligned with what users value most about GameChanger. This role is ideal for someone who takes ownership, is energized by hands-on work and enjoys building native mobile applications. What You'll Do: Lead development of new advertising features and components in our native iOS app, including new ad surfaces, rendering logic, and mobile first UI. Build high quality, user facing features in Swift or SwiftUI that balance business goals with a seamless product experience. Partner with product and design to shape mobile ad requirements, propose technical approaches, and influence the direction of in app advertising. Collaborate with engineers across iOS, backend, and data teams to make architectural decisions that support ad delivery, measurement, and performance. Promote clarity and understanding on complex problems, especially when working through tradeoffs across user experience, performance, and reliability. Ensure the reliability, maintainability, and performance of new ad surfaces, including instrumentation, testing strategies, and ongoing iteration after release. Contribute to and uphold strong engineering practices, including code quality, documentation, and review processes. Mentor teammates and share knowledge across the broader iOS engineering group. Our apps are written in Swift and have a Reactive architecture using technologies like Swift Composable Architecture (TCA), SwiftUI, Realm, and RxSwift. Who You Are: 4+ years of experience building and shipping native iOS applications in Swift or SwiftUI Own feature development and work from concept through launch. Experience working on mobile UI, design systems, or performance-sensitive features. Knowledge of the Advertising industry's main concepts and technologies like ad serving, bidding, and targeting. Familiarity with data privacy laws and regulations. Comfortable working in small team environments with high autonomy, broad ownership, and close partnership with product and design Ability to evaluate new technologies and introduce improvements to the iOS codebase. Experience giving and receiving feedback through design and code reviews. Experience communicating updates and resolutions to teammates about technical tradeoffs and propose scalable solutions. Excited about AI tools and using them to increase quality and efficiency. Experience mentoring engineers or contributing to team-wide technical growth. Perks: Work remotely throughout the US* or from our well-furnished, modern office in Manhattan, NY. Unlimited vacation policy. Paid volunteer opportunities. Technology stipend - $4,000 every 2 years after your start to make sure you have the latest and greatest technology WFH stipend - $500 annually to make your WFH situation comfortable. Learning stipend - $500 annually towards continued development Monthly physical, mental, wellness & learning stipend offered through Holisticly Monthly lifestyle stipend offered through Fringe Full health benefits - medical, dental, vision, prescription, FSA, HRA, HSA, and coverage for family/dependents. Retirement savings - Traditional and Roth 401K plans are offered through Vanguard, with an immediate company match. Life insurance - basic life, supplemental life, and dependent life. Disability leave - short-term disability and long-term disability. Company paid parental leave - up to 20 weeks for birthing parents and up to 12 weeks for non-birthing parents. Family building benefits offered through Progyny. DICK'S Sporting Goods and their family of brands teammate discount. The target salary range for this position is between $160,000 and $180,000. This is part of a total compensation package that includes incentive, equity, and benefits for eligible roles. Individual pay may vary from the target range and is determined by several factors including experience, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. We constantly review all teammate pay to ensure a great compensation package that is fair and equal across the board. DICK'S Sporting Goods has company-wide practices to monitor and protect the company from significant compliance and monetary implications as it pertains to employer state tax liabilities. Due to said guidelines put in place, we are unable to hire in AK, DE, HI, IA, LA, MS, MT, OK, and SC. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Our Interview Process & AI We recognize that AI has become a common part of everyday life and professional work, and its use continues to evolve rapidly. Our perspective on AI in the hiring process will evolve as well. At this time, we ask that candidates please refrain from using AI tools during interviews and assessments, as we want to see your authentic self. We will clearly indicate if and when AI use is acceptable in the process. If you have any questions or need accommodations, we're here to help. Thanks for helping us keep the process fair and secure for everyone! IMPORTANT NOTICE: All official recruitment communications from GameChanger will come from an email address ending in @gc.com or no-reply@ashby.hq.com. If you receive communication from any other domain, please be cautious, as it is likely fraudulent. Compensation Range: $160K - $180K

title: CAx Developer
description: Moog is a performance culture that empowers people to achieve great things. Our people enjoy solving interesting technical challenges in a culture where everyone trusts each other to do the right thing. For you, working with us can mean deeper job satisfaction, better rewards, and a great quality of life inside and outside of work. Job Title: CAx Developer Reporting To: Director, AG Mach Automation Prog Work Schedule: Onsite – Buffalo, NY Moog's Military Aircraft Group, Manufacturing Engineering team is looking for a Computer Aided Application Developer to join them. You will report to the Manufacturing Engineering Director and will have a full-time on-site work schedule in East Aurora, NY. You will be responsible for a variety of application support and development related primarily to Siemens NX and TeamCenter as well as supporting post-processors for all software used by the MAG ME team (currently PartMaker, Esprit, and NX) for which you will be the technical resource for internal development (coding) of post-processors for NX and lead post related training or procurement efforts. This role is pivotal in supporting our growing manufacturing operations for MAG East Aurora. In addition to this core responsibility, you will be integrated with other technical advancement opportunities and projects to help position MAG EA for further growth and engineering efficiencies. This includes, but is not limited to, TeamCenter and NX add in software such as Material Resource Libraries (MRL), AI Assisted Programming, and Model Based Definition (MBD) stage model standard work. To be considered for the CAx Developer position, you will need to bring with you: A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field Equivalent professional experience may be considered in lieu of a degree 4+ years of progressive technical experience with NX CAM Experience in NX CAM configuration and journaling automation is a plus Experience using Post Builder, Post Configurator, and programming Experience in the use of .tcl files is preferred Strong working experience with a variety of machine controls Proven aptitude and experience in the development of software solutions Demonstrated capabilities in Statement of Work (SOW) authoring and vendor management Excellent written and oral communication skills; demonstrated competence communicating with all levels of the organization and providing exception customer service Demonstrated project management experience in scoping, planning, and executing deliverables to support the business As a CAx Developer you will: Field requests from users in Moog Military Aircraft Group East Aurora for post development, and deliver functioning software within project timelines Function as the Service Owner for MAG post development routed through Enterprise IT, responsible for developing service roadmaps, reporting, managing customer demand, and implementing continuous improvement efforts to constantly evolve the service. Refine enterprise IT processes for the requisition and delivery of post processors, helping to develop and enforce technical standards regarding things like integration methods or code structure Establish a portfolio of external service providers, and maintain customer relationships, leading Moog to make the best possible make-buy decisions for post-processor procurement Develop and or facilitate training for other MAG engineering resources which develop posts Remain engaged in supporting internal MAG customers through the lifecycle of post development, procurement, delivery, and sustainment Support MAG users with NX CAM questions, issues, and help drive enterprise CAM configurations Collaborate as part of the Enterprise IT Applications organization, leveraging relationships with peer leaders to drive improvement of IT services across the organization. Serve as the subject matter expert for MAG, driving the development and growth of capabilities in the organization to support this workstream long term Help to understand and develop standard work in support of Model Based Definition (MBD) as it pertains to the MAG shop operations team Identify and champion CAx solutions that will improve MAG operation efficiencies. Lead the investigation, trials, and implementation of AI assisted CNC programming in MAG. Stay connected to the Enterprise IT team for any planned software upgrades and understand any impact it may have on CAx systems used in Military Aircraft Group. How We Care for You: Financial Rewards: great compensation package, annual profit sharing, matching 401k and the ability to participate in Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Flexible Spending and Health Savings Accounts Work/Life Balance: Flexible paid time off, holidays and parental leave program, relocation assistance Health & Welfare: Comprehensive insurance coverage including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, Employee Assistance Plan ("EAP") and other supplemental benefit coverages Professional Skills Development: Tuition Assistance, mentorship and coaching opportunities, leadership development and other personal growth programs Diverse and Inclusive Workplace: Employee Resource Groups, cultural events and celebrations Salary Range Transparency: Buffalo, NY $90,000.00–$130,000.00 Annually Salary Range Disclaimer The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Moog salary range for this position in the given work location. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range(s) listed is just one component of Moog's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, employee stock purchase plan, an open paid time off policy, and many region-specific benefits. This position requires access to U.S. export-controlled information. EOE/AA Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran Moog is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such affirms the right of every person to participate in all aspects of employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic. If you are interested in applying for employment and need special assistance or an accommodation to apply for a posted position, contact our Human Resources department via phone at 844-367-5787. No unsolicited agency submittals please. Agency partners must be invited to participate in a search by our Talent Acquisition Team and have signed terms in place prior to any submittal. Absent compliance with these pre-conditions resumes submitted directly to any Moog Inc. employee or affiliate will not qualify for fee payment, and therefore become the property of Moog Inc.
company_description: Our company began in 1951 with Bill Moog's invention, the servovalve, which became the heart of high performance motion control systems.

title: Lead ServiceNow Developer (Remote)
description: Melville,NY - USA Position Requirements The ServiceNow Lead Developer is a strategic, hands-on leader responsible for the technical architecture, development, and governance of the enterprise platform. This role owns advanced configuration and scripting, drives high-quality code standards through rigorous review and mentorship, and manages complex API-driven integrations. The Lead Developer ensures technical solutions are scalable, maintains platform health, and provides critical expertise within the Agile development lifecycle. RESPONSIBILITIES Provide technical and strategic leadership for the ServiceNow platform's development, maintenance, and growth, ensuring alignment with organizational goals. Partner with business stakeholders to translate requirements into robust, scalable technical designs and solutions within ServiceNow. Mentor and coach developers, leading code/design reviews to enforce high quality, efficiency, and maintainable development standards. Drive the technical aspects of the Agile process, including assisting with story refinement (stories, acceptance criteria), estimation, and task distribution. Own daily technical governance, proactively managing the platform's health, security compliance, and performance optimization. Design, build, and maintain complex, resilient integrations using modern standards like REST, SOAP, JSON, and scripting languages. Actively participate in key cross-functional Agile ceremonies, such as daily stand-ups, planning meetings, technical demos, and design reviews, to ensure technical solutions are aligned and integrated with other development teams across the organization. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Deep technical expertise in ServiceNow configuration (Business Rules, Flow Designer) and advanced proficiency in JavaScript, Scoped Applications, and API consumption/design (REST/SOAP). Extensive experience operating within modern Agile/Scrum/Kanban methodologies, contributing to efficient team delivery and cadence. Exceptional communication, influencing, and leadership skills for team mentorship and interfacing with senior clients. Typically requires 6+ years of progressive experience in ServiceNow development, with a proven track record of leading feature development and technical leadership. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA) and at least one Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) are frequently required or strongly preferred (e.g., ITSM, HRSD, ITOM). Additional industry certifications that demonstrate specialized technical depth or business acumen (e.g., ITIL, PMP, AWS/Azure, JavaScript frameworks, CISM/CISSP) TOTAL REWARDS: Salary: $126,168 - $173,482 per year Generous benefits package, including: Paid Time Off Health, life, vision, dental, disability, and AD&D insurance Flexible Spending Accounts/Health Savings Accounts 401(k) Leadership and professional development opportunities The ServiceNow Lead Developer is a strategic, hands-on leader responsible for the technical architecture, development, and governance of the enterprise platform. This role owns advanced configuration and scripting, drives high-quality code standards through rigorous review and mentorship, and manages complex API-driven integrations. The Lead Developer ensures technical solutions are scalable, maintains platform health, and provides critical expertise within the Agile development lifecycle. EEO Statement North American Partners in Anesthesia is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Application Developer for Capital Integrated Data Solutions
description: Application Developer for Capital Integrated Data Solutions DEPT OF PARKS & RECREATION Posted On: 11/21/2025 Full-Time Location QUEENS Exam May Be Required Department CP DC For Capital Projects Salary Range: $100,000.00 – $109,518.00 Save Job Description This vacancy is only open to 1) current permanent Parks employees serving in the Computer Specialist (Software) civil service title or 2) on leave from the title or 3) permanent Parks employees in or on leave from a comparable title. *ONLY OPEN TO CURRENT FULL-TIME ANNUALLY PAID PARKS EMPLOYEES* Major Responsibilities Report to the Supervisor of Application Development (under the Deputy Director of Capital Integrated Data Solutions), develop new modules and applications and maintain and improve the Capital Division's existing Windows-based software. Work closely with the team to plan and decide what new features our project-tracking tools need, then write clear code to bring those ideas to life. Build and improve our custom apps by writing scripts and programs in Visual Basic, ASP .NET, and Access so they run smoothly. Test each new feature and change carefully to find any mistakes, fix them and make sure everything works as expected. Write simple, step-by-step guides and reports that show how the software works and explain best ways to use it. Create and run SQL procedures and views to move, clean, and organize project data so everyone has the right information. Keep an eye on the applications after they go live to spot problems early, tune performance and update scripts or settings when needed. Help staff members when they have questions or run into trouble using our software, guiding them through fixes in easy-to-understand steps. Work Location: Olmsted Center, Queens How to Apply: Go to cityjobs.nyc.gov and search for Job ID# 757742. All applicants must apply via cityjobs.nyc.gov. The City is no longer using ESS to accept applications. Current Employees please include your ERN on your cover letter and resume. nyc.gov/parks NOTE: All resumes must be received no later than the last day of the posting period. References will be required upon request. MOVEMENT IN THE FACE OF CIVIL SERVICE LISTS IS PROHIBITED UNDER CIVIL SERVICE LAW. For information about applying for Civil Service Exams go to: Civil Service Exams - Department of Citywide Administrative Services (nyc.gov) COMPUTER SPECIALIST (SOFTWARE) - 13632 Minimum Qualifications (1) A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college, including or supplemented by twenty-four (24) semester credits in computer science or a related computer field and two (2) years of satisfactory full-time software experience in designing, programming, debugging, maintaining, implementing, and enhancing computer software applications, systems programming, systems analysis and design, data communication software, or database design and programming, including one year in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project; or (2) A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and six (6) years of full-time satisfactory software experience as described in "1" above, including one year in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project; or (3) A satisfactory combination of education and experience that is equivalent to (1) or (2) above. College education may be substituted for up to two years of the required experience in (2) above on the basis that sixty (60) semester credits from an accredited college is equated to one year of experience. A masters degree in computer science or a related computer field may be substituted for one year of the required experience in (1) or (2) above. However, all candidates must have a four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent, plus at least one (1) year of satisfactory full-time software experience in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project. NOTE: In order to have your experience accepted as Project Leader or Major Contributor experience, you must explain in detail how your experience qualifies you as a project leader or as a major contributor. Experience in computer operations, technical support, quality assurance (QA), hardware installation, help desk, or as an end user will not be accepted for meeting the minimum qualification requirements. Special Note To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level IV, in addition to the Qualification Requirements stated above, individuals must have one year of satisfactory experience in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project in data administration, database management systems, operating systems, data communications systems, capacity planning, and/or on-line applications programming. Preferred Skills 1. Strong interpersonal, communication and organizational skills. 2. Expertise in Excel, Access or other similar numerical/data analysis programs. 3. Well-developed skills in associated database programming languages with an emphasis on MS SQL Server. 4. Comprehension of query plan, good query tuning skills and diverse experience improving query performance. 5. Good working knowledge of Object Oriented Programming concepts and basic data structures. 6. Knowledge of SQL queries and data views. 7. Familiarity with Visual Basic for Applications and Macros. 8. Ability to meet deadlines and identify and resolve issues with minimal direction. 55a Program This position is also open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a Program. Please indicate at the top of your resume and cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position through the 55-a Program. Public Service Loan Forgiveness As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education's website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/. Residency Requirement This position is exempt from NYC residency requirements. Additional Information The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy. title: Senior iOS Engineer
description: Senior iOS Engineer (Mobile Lead, Web3 Focus) Location: Remote - NY or CA preference - will consider US remote Compensation: $250K - $375K We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior iOS Engineer to take the mobile lead role in shaping the user experience for an innovative, new asset layer and decentralized platform. This is a unique opportunity to drive the architecture, development, and evolution of our native iOS applications, focusing on delivering a simple, elegant, and trustworthy mobile experience for complex on-chain asset interactions. You will act as both a hands-on technical contributor and a mentor, shaping the mobile engineering culture alongside product, design, and Web3 teams. As the Senior iOS Engineer, you will be the mobile expert responsible for defining how users engage with our platform's next-generation asset layer. Your primary focus will be on delivering exceptional UI/UX for consumers, creators, and communities on iOS. Key Responsibilities Lead Development: Lead the design and implementation of the flagship consumer-facing iOS application, covering core flows like asset discovery, launch, trading, social interactions, wallet connectivity, onboarding, and notifications. UI/UX Partnership: Collaborate intimately with UI/UX designers to translate high-fidelity designs into pixel-perfect native iOS interfaces, including custom animations, refined transitions, adaptive layouts, accessibility, and internationalization. Technical Architecture: Architect and implement scalable, maintainable mobile solutions using best practices (e.g., MVVM/Clean Architecture, reactive programming, modularization, dependency injection). Feature Definition: Partner with product and design teams to define mobile-specific user journeys, retention drivers, onboarding conversion, and mobile-first social features. Performance & Security: Ensure the application's performance, reliability, and security, including crash-free operation, network resilience, secure key handling (where applicable), and efficient use of resources. Analytics & Iteration: Utilize analytics and telemetry to monitor user behavior (engagement, conversion) and define instrumentation to drive continuous UX and performance improvements. Mentorship: Mentor and guide other mobile engineers through code reviews, establishing mobile best practices, continuous delivery pipelines, and robust testing strategies (unit, UI, integration). Innovation: Stay current with iOS platform advancements and the intersection of Web3/blockchain and mobile technology, proposing cutting-edge improvements to the architecture and user experience. Requirements Experience: 3+ years of professional experience in native iOS application development, specifically shipping polished consumer-facing apps to the App Store. Technical Proficiency: Excellent proficiency in Swift (and UIKit/SwiftUI ) with proven experience designing robust architecture for large-scale production applications. UI/UX Polish: A demonstrable portfolio of iOS apps showcasing strong UI/UX polish: fluid animations, refined transitions, customized UI components, and adaptive layouts. Design Acumen: Deep understanding of mobile UX design principles and Apple Human Interface Guidelines (HIG), with a keen eye for interaction quality and design detail. Collaboration: Strong collaboration skills, comfortable participating in product discovery, defining mobile flows, and iterating quickly with designers and product managers. Performance: Experience with performance optimization (startup time, memory/CPU, responsiveness), mobile analytics instrumentation, and crash/performance monitoring tools. Leadership: Solid experience mentoring peers, establishing mobile engineering practices, and leading comprehensive code reviews. Mindset: Passion for or willingness to dive deep into the Web3/blockchain frontier and mobile user experiences for token-related interactions and social finance. Startup Experience: Must have prior experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment. Portfolio Requirement: Please include a link to a portfolio showcasing your work (Must). Benefits Competitive Compensation: A highly competitive salary ranging from $250,000 to $375,000 USD , commensurate with experience and impact. Impactful Role: The opportunity to single-handedly shape the mobile experience of a cutting-edge Web3 platform that is redefining how creators, communities, and social engagement interact with digital assets. Design-Driven Culture: Work within a design-driven engineering culture where mobile UX is prioritized equally with protocol and backend development. High Visibility: Join a small, high-impact mobile team where your architectural decisions and code contributions will be immediately visible and highly valued. Global Exposure: Gain exposure to global markets, evolving social/mobile behavior, community-driven models, and bleeding-edge Web3/mobile interactions. Innovation: An environment that champions rapid experimentation, mobile innovation, and direct feedback from real user behavior. Due to the high volume of applications we anticipate, we regret that we are unable to provide individual feedback to all candidates. You are expected to be involved in the design and architecture of the solutions while also focusing on the entire SDLC lifecycle stages. title: Senior .NET Developer
description: Position Details Title: Healthcare/Clinical .NET Developer with HL7 Position Type: Contract/ 40 hours per week Location: Long Island City, NY (Onsite) Interview Type: Onsite Due to client restrictions, only GC or USC might be considered for this position. Qualifications & Requirements Prior experience in a clinical or laboratory environment . 7+ years of professional software development experience. Expert proficiency in C# and .NET / .NET Core framework . 3+ years of hands-on experience with HL7 (v2) , with detailed knowledge of segments such as PID, PV1, OBR, ORC , and message types ORM, ORU . Proven experience developing and deploying services using ASP.NET Core (Web API, Microservices) . Strong knowledge of Microservices and Event-Driven Architecture . Proficiency in SQL & SQL Server including stored procedures and query optimization. Experience working with SSIS packages . Experience with reporting tools: SSRS, Power BI , or similar. Experience with Azure cloud services (App Services, Functions, Service Bus/Event Hub). Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field. Summary of Position We are seeking a highly skilled Senior .NET Developer to join our core team focused on the "eOrder" initiative —a mission-critical project aimed at modernizing and streamlining the electronic transmission and processing of laboratory and radiology orders between our EHR system and external/internal providers. This work is central to modern healthcare data exchange and system interoperability. You will be responsible for the full lifecycle development—including design, development, deployment, and maintenance—of integration services and APIs that handle high-volume clinical data. Deep expertise in HL7 messaging standards is essential for success in this role. Job Duties Design, develop, and maintain integration engines and middleware using C# / .NET Core to process, parse, transform, and validate HL7 messages (v2/v3, CDA) related to ORM (Orders) and ORU (Results). Build secure, high-performance RESTful APIs and microservices using ASP.NET Core for order management and status tracking. Work with relational ( SQL Server ) and NoSQL databases, ensuring optimized queries, data integrity, and effective storage/logging. Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines and deploy services using Azure DevOps within an Azure cloud environment with focus on performance and security. Troubleshoot message routing, MLLP/HTTPS transport protocols , and mapping issues in the integration layer. Collaborate with clinical analysts, interface engineers, and QA teams to ensure compliance with clinical and regulatory requirements. Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent Pay: $50.00 - $65.00 per hour Expected hours: 40 per week Work Location: In person

title: Systems Developer (New York) Apply for this job
description: BA Global Talent is looking for a qualified professional to join a dynamic team as an on-site Systems Developer in Albany, NY . This opportunity is tied to the New York State HBITS contract to work for the Office of Mental Health . You will play a crucial role in interpreting and analyzing business requirements to build application logic. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining n-tier web deployments and secure .Net web-services. Responsibilities: Develop and maintain applications using Microsoft Visual Studio, C#, and ASP.NET for n-tier web deployment. Interpret and analyze business requirements and build the logic within an application's code to meet those requirements. Design and maintain Oracle databases, including PL SQL coding, stored procedures, packages, indexes, and triggers. Develop secure .Net web-services using Windows Communication Foundation (WCF), REST Services (Web API), message processing, and Enterprise Service Bus. Develop reports with Crystal Reports and invoke them from .NET applications. Maintain applications containing Health Care data under HIPAA Protected Health Information (PHI). Adhere to company policies and procedures. Requirements: 7+ years of experience using Microsoft Visual Studio to develop/maintain applications in C#, ASP.NET for n-tier web deployment. 7+ years of experience developing and maintaining web applications that utilize HTML, XML, JSON, AJAX, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, and Cascading Style Sheets. 7+ years of experience with Oracle: Database design, PL SQL coding, stored procedures, packages, indexes, triggers, creating tables, etc. 7+ years of experience interpreting and analyzing business requirements and building the logic within an application's code to meet those requirements. 6+ years of experience developing applications with MVC 5 or later versions. 6+ years experience with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) application integration, including development of secure .NET web-services using Windows Communication Foundation (WCF), REST Services (Web API), message processing, and Enterprise Service Bus. 4+ years of experience developing reports with Crystal Reports version 10 or above and invoking them from .NET applications. 3+ years of experience with Team Foundation Server (TFS) and GitLab, including CI/CD for source code management. 2+ years of experience coding and maintaining applications that contain Health Care data that fall under HIPAA Protected Health Information (PHI). Must provide three (3) professional references from previous roles upon request. Time Zone: EST Schedule: Full-time Location: On-site Albany, NY Engagement Length: 30 months, with the possibility of extension or renewal. Only resumes submitted in English will be considered. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for job opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin. BA Global Talent connects professionals across the Americas with meaningful opportunities at U.S. companies. We specialize in remote recruitment, HR operations, and workforce solutions, with a strong focus on transparency, support, and long-term success. At BA , you're never just a placement; you're part of a team that values growth, autonomy, and impact. title: .NET Full Stack Developer (ArcGIS)
description: Title: .NET Full Stack Developer (ArcGIS) Location: 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271- Onsite job Duration: 18+ months (7 hrs/day job) Required Skills: Minimum of 4 years of experience writing application software, performing data analysis and data access, working with data structures, data manipulation, databases, programming, testing, implementation, and developing technical/user documentation and software conversions across environments including mainframe, mid-range, personal computers, and laptops. Ability to assist and/or lead in designing program specifications and implementing software solutions. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Systems, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), or a related field; Master's degree is a plus. 4+ years of experience as a full stack .NET Developer with hands-on expertise in C#, VB.NET, ASP.NET, .NET Core, .NET 9.0, Entity Framework, MVC, SQL Server, and Azure. Strong understanding of front-end technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks such as React or Angular. Minimum of 2 years of experience in ArcGIS Pro and/or ArcMap-based GIS solution design and development. Experience with RESTful API development and integration. Hands-on experience with ArcGIS Maps SDK for .NET, Python, ArcPy, Arcade, and Model Builder to create or extend editing tools in ArcGIS Pro. Proficiency with ESRI products including ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Enterprise (Server, Portal, SDE DataStore), ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGIS Online, and ArcMap. Experience working with geospatial data types in Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle/Oracle Spatial, and PostgreSQL/PostGIS. Experience with MS-SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, and other geospatial databases. Strong teamwork and collaboration skills. Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and deliver projects on time and within scope. Strong knowledge of software architecture principles, design patterns, and best practices. Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools supporting continuous integration and delivery. Experience using application lifecycle management (ALM) tools such as Azure DevOps and GitHub extensions. Proficiency with version control using Git and GitHub and experience with release management practices. Excellent problem-solving abilities. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Microsoft Azure certifications are a plus. Experience working effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Project Scope: Design and implement full stack solutions using Microsoft .NET technologies, including C#, VB.NET, ASP.NET, .NET Core, .NET 9.0, Entity Framework, JavaScript libraries, and ArcGIS Maps SDK for .NET. Identify, analyze, and develop interfaces and integration flows using Visual Studio Application platform. Develop and optimize database structures and queries using Microsoft SQL Server to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval. title: Software Engineer
description: Educational Networks is on the lookout for talented and motivated software engineers to join our dynamic team. As a leading provider of content management systems (CMS) for educational institutions, our software powers over 2,500 school and district websites across the United States. Our mission is to create detailed and customizable solutions that cater to the unique needs of individual schools, significantly benefiting teachers, parents, and students alike. At EduNet, we pride ourselves on our innovative approach and dedication to high-quality software development. Our engineers work on both backend and frontend projects, tackling highly technical and sensitive infrastructure tasks. We are committed to building efficient, reliable, scalable, and maintainable software that enhances user experiences through meticulous design and implementation. Join us in facing technical challenges that require deep understanding and creativity, all while avoiding mainstream frameworks to achieve unique solutions. Work on highly technical and sensitive infrastructure projects. Build features and innovative user experiences through meticulous design and implementation. Strong understanding of Object-Oriented Programming in Java. Experience with distributed systems, networking, and microservices. Proficiency in multi-threaded programming. Knowledge of relational databases, particularly MySQL. Strong understanding of computer architecture and operating systems. Expertise in software reliability, monitoring, fault tolerance, and self-repair. title: Senior Fullstack Engineer (Backend) — New Products
description: About Rippling Rippling gives businesses one place to run HR, IT, and Finance. It brings together all of the workforce systems that are normally scattered across a company, like payroll, expenses, benefits, and computers. For the first time ever, you can manage and automate every part of the employee lifecycle in a single system. Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can hire a new employee anywhere in the world and set up their payroll, corporate card, computer, benefits, and even third-party apps like Slack and Microsoft 365—all within 90 seconds. Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $1.4B+ from the world's top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, Greenoaks, and Bedrock—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes. We prioritize candidate safety. Please be aware that all official communication will only be sent from @Rippling.com addresses. About the role Join us in founding a new team building AI-first products and experiences that will become core to how our customers manage and grow their businesses. As a Senior Fullstack Software Engineer, you'll be one of the early members helping define the architecture, systems, and product experience. You'll work closely with product, design, and other engineering teams to bring the products from idea to scale. This is a rare chance to own and influence a zero-to-one product, shaping the direction of both the technology and the user experience. We're looking for engineers who are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy fast-paced development, and care deeply about building fantastic products that sit on top of reliable and reusable systems. This role will be part of Rippling's core AI initiatives so an interest in the intersection of AI and UX is a plus. This is an opportunity to build a product from the ground up: you'll collaborate closely with design and product to take ideas from whiteboard to production, move fast in tight feedback loops, and make smart technical decisions that stand the test of scale. We're looking for someone who thrives in ambiguity, cares about the craft of software, and is excited to build systems that are both delightful to use and reliable under the hood. You'll have significant ownership, a voice in what we build and how we build it, and a chance to influence the foundation of something ambitious. What you will do Design and implement fullstack features with minimal oversight Translate product requirements into technical solutions across the stack Help define and build the foundational architecture of the new product Collaborate with other teams across engineering and go-to-market to understand requirements and integrate with Rippling's platform Write high-quality, well-tested code and contribute to technical documentation Participate in code reviews and help establish engineering best practices for the team What you will need A minimum 5 years of experience as a software engineer Experience building and shipping production software in a fullstack environment Familiarity with technologies like Python, Django, React, Postgres, MongoDB, and AWS (or similar stacks) Ability to independently break down complex problems and drive them to completion Strong product instincts and a track record of working effectively with cross-functional teams Comfort working in an early-stage environment where priorities may shift quickly The pay range for this role is: 159,000 - 278,250 USD per year(US Tier 1)

title: Website Developer
description: Rockland BOCES - Website Developer The award-winning Rockland BOCES Communications Service is seeking a Website Developer to provide customized website development, website redesign, content management and technical support to public school districts in the Rockland BOCES region. Description: In this key role, the Website Developer provides sound guidance, strategy, technical expertise and support to effectively shape clients' external digital messaging. They are responsible for the creation and management of website pages, ensuring they are visually compelling, technically efficient and compliant with the latest accessibility standards. The Website Developer must be self-directed and possess strong organizational skills, along with expertise in project management, software development and network configurations. The role also involves routinely collaborating with fellow members of the Communications Service, contributing to a shared service model that offers a comprehensive depth of expertise to clients. To ensure the best digital solutions for clients, the Website Developer must stay current with global trends in digital communications and be prepared to recommend new technologies and techniques. Success in this position requires an individual to be a strong team player who demonstrates interpersonal, creative and visionary skills. Through their technical and strategic contributions, the Website Developer ensures that clients can effectively inform and engage their communities using cutting-edge digital platforms. The Website Developer manages all aspects of our clients' website presence, from initial design to ongoing maintenance and compliance. This is a Civil Service position. Responsibilities: Designs, creates, implements, manipulates and integrates websites and pages that are visually compelling, technically efficient and compliant with usability and accessibility guidelines. Meets with clients to determine their website needs and analyzes requests. Coordinates web project timelines and reviews project schedules with the team leader and school district personnel to ensure timeframes are appropriate and can be met. Manages a content management workflow ticketing system to track website content creation and publication tasks, converting them into tickets that move through an approval and publishing process. Maintain website staff directories and user access. Maintain the highest digital presence standards, ensuring all content is consistent with branding and style guides. Maintain overall compliance, accessibility and user-friendliness of BOCES and District websites. Evaluate emerging digital communications solutions and make recommendations on adding these tools to the school district's communication strategy. Monitor and analyze website performance (e.g., traffic, conversions, etc.) Performs related work as required. Education: A Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, Web Development, Graphic Technology, Graphic Design, Computer Graphics, Management Information Systems or comparable degree and two years of paid work experience in the design or development of websites as the major function of the work (major function is defined as 50% or more of the day-to-day work experience) Requirements: Possession of an appropriate level, valid Driver's License at the time of appointment and must be maintained throughout the appointment; Excellent project management skills and the ability to effectively balance competing priorities and deadlines; Ability to work both independently with minimal supervision and effectively in a team setting. Initiative and common sense are essential, bringing energy and flexibility to the team environment; Ability to read, interpret, analyze and summarize complex concepts/written documents; Strong analytical and diagnostic skills and the ability to acquire knowledge of BOCES and school district operations and complex educational issues; Ability to establish and maintain effective and comfortable working relationships with others; Proficiency in web design principles, including HTML, CSS and graphic design software; Working knowledge of web programming languages for site design and HTML and Web utilities (e.g., web browsers, FTP, audio), as well as skill in web authoring and knowledge of systems analysis as it applies to web programming; Demonstrated experience with website content management systems (CMS); Knowledge of web accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG) and related compliance requirements; and Experience with mobile app management and mass notification systems is a plus. This is a full-time position. About Us: Our team of messaging experts is focused on strengthening the connections between public schools and local families, students, staff, partners and community members. We believe that, through effective communication, school district leaders can build a high level of trust within their communities. Contact: Scott Salotto Rockland BOCES Executive Director of Communications and Governmental Relations Email: ssalotto@rboces.org (No Phone Calls) rocklandboces.org Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $78,557.00 per year Benefits: Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible spending account Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Work Location: In person
